title: 22 Pretty, Everyday Dresses to Throw on Any Day of the Week
text: Let me start with a confession. Dresses and I have a bit of a love-hate relationship. I don't know what it is, but I really struggle to find a dress that I feel truly suits me. But once I find one, I treasure it even more than my go-to jeans or trousers. So this year, I'm determined to find an easy, everyday dress that can fit seamlessly into my wardrobe and break up my daily jeans-and-top rotation.During the spring months and as we move into summer, the definition of an easy, everyday dress really broadens. And at the end of the day, it comes down to whatever your personal style may be. Sunnier days may mean it's time to whip out the mini dress like Lucy Williams, if you like to show off your pins. But we all know spring weather can be finicky, and that means that a midi-length knitted style is seasonally appropriate too.The key is to focus on finding styles that are incredibly versatile. That means choosing neutral colors—or at least tones that integrate easily into your current wardrobe—and minimalist silhouettes. These dresses can be styled in so many ways. Pair with sneakers and jackets for casual day looks, or dress them up with strappy heels and an oversize blazer for a chic evening outfit. However you style them, I'm confident you'll find them just as useful and stylish as all your other wardrobe staples.THE BEST EASY DRESSES H&M Tie-Back Poplin Dress Reformation Everett Linen Dress H&M Tie-Detail Maxi Dress BERNADETTE Georgio Gathered Floral-Print Linen Maxi Dress MANGO Linen and Lyocell-Blend Shirt Dress With Belt Reformation Michelle Dress H&M Defined-Waist Maxi Dress DÔEN Ischia Shirred Gingham Cotton-Voile Midi Dress Madewell Scoopneck Sleeveless Midi Dress in 100% Linen ESSE STUDIOS Dasha Duo Asymmetric Cutout Stretch-Knit and Gauze Maxi Dress Reformation Michelle Dress TOTEME Pleated Organic Cotton-Jersey Midi Dress Reformation Roslyn Linen Dress H&M Pintuck-Detail Dress With Flared Skirt DÔEN Helaine Crocheted and Pintucked Cotton-Voile Midi Dress ZIMMERMANN Ribbed-Knit and Cotton-Poplin Midi Dress Opening Image: @monikh Jess Kelham-Hohler is a freelance writer, editor and content strategist. She has been a contributor for Who What Wear UK since 2023. Currently based in London following six years in Washington D.C. and New York, she was previously the Digital Editor for Soho House & Co, an international group of private members’ clubs for creatives. She has interviewed a range of artists, creators and more, including Alighieri founder Rosh Mahtani, photographer Misan Harriman and fashion editor Lindsay Peoples Wagner. Today, she writes primarily about fashion, travel and culture for various publications, and has worked as a copywriter and content strategist for brands such as Belstaff, Olivela and Equinox.
html:
Let me start with a confession. Dresses and I have a bit of a love-hate relationship. I don't know what it is, but I really struggle to find a dress that I feel truly suits me. But once I find one, I treasure it even more than my go-to jeans or trousers. So this year, I'm determined to find an easy, everyday dress that can fit seamlessly into my wardrobe and break up my daily jeans-and-top rotation.

During the spring months and as we move into summer, the definition of an easy, everyday dress really broadens. And at the end of the day, it comes down to whatever your personal style may be. Sunnier days may mean it's time to whip out the mini dress like Lucy Williams, if you like to show off your pins. But we all know spring weather can be finicky, and that means that a midi-length knitted style is seasonally appropriate too.

The key is to focus on finding styles that are incredibly versatile. That means choosing neutral colors—or at least tones that integrate easily into your current wardrobe—and minimalist silhouettes. These dresses can be styled in so many ways. Pair with sneakers and jackets for casual day looks, or dress them up with strappy heels and an oversize blazer for a chic evening outfit. However you style them, I'm confident you'll find them just as useful and stylish as all your other wardrobe staples.

THE BEST EASY DRESSES

Opening Image: @monikh

Jess Kelham-Hohler is a freelance writer, editor and content strategist. She has been a contributor for Who What Wear UK since 2023. Currently based in London following six years in Washington D.C. and New York, she was previously the Digital Editor for Soho House & Co, an international group of private members’ clubs for creatives. She has interviewed a range of artists, creators and more, including Alighieri founder Rosh Mahtani, photographer Misan Harriman and fashion editor Lindsay Peoples Wagner. Today, she writes primarily about fashion, travel and culture for various publications, and has worked as a copywriter and content strategist for brands such as Belstaff, Olivela and Equinox.
